snippet: The drenching rainstorm that settled in California on Tuesday came as the state wheezed its way into the fourth year of the worst drought in centuries.
abstract: Drenching rainstorms hit California, providing brief respite for region in its fourth year of worst drought in centuries; storms are forecast to bring two to six inches of rain over 24 hours, possibly region's biggest rainfall in years; although welcome, downpours raise concerns about mudslides.

byline.contributor: Noah Gilbert contributed reporting from Los Angeles, and Brandon Shaw from Glendora, Calif.

lead_paragraph: The drenching rainstorm that settled in California on Tuesday came as the state wheezed its way into the fourth year of the worst drought in centuries.

headline.main: In Midst of California’s Drought, a Rainy Day Is a Welcome Sight
headline.print_headline: In Midst of California’s Drought, a Rainy Day Is a Welcome Sight
